§ 8794. Waiver The President may waive the requirement to include a person on a list required by section 8791, 8792, or 8793 of this title or to impose sanctions pursuant to any such section if the President—(1) determines that such a waiver is in the national security interests of the United States; and
(2) submits to the appropriate congressional committees a report on the reasons for that determination.
(Pub. L. 112–158, title VII, § 705, Aug. 10, 2012, 126 Stat. 1268.)
